courses.title: World Building for Virtual Production
courses.path: G:\Shared drives\ELT Division\Professional Group Training\CURRENT COURSE CONTENT\VIDEOS\19-Worldbuilding\219.01-World Building for Virtual Production

learning_objectives: Utilize construction blueprints to quickly populate a scene with assets.
Set up basic lighting using Lumen and the Environment Light Mixer.
Modify asset pivots using the built-in modeling tools.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of the Unreal Engine 5 interface.
Familiarity with the Content Browser.
Experience with importing assets.
ai_analysis.difficulty_notes: While the course is tagged as intermediate, some topics like DDC might be a bit complex for true beginners. Overall, the video provides a surface-level overview of multiple features, making it potentially accessible to advanced beginners with some hands-on experience.

Apply materials and paint layers on the landscape to define different terrains.

Implement virtual texturing for landscapes to improve performance and visual fidelity.

subtopics: Level Management and Organization in Unreal Engine
Sequencer for Shot Planning and Organization
Integrating Real-time Tools into Legacy Pipelines
Collaboration and Data Management with Unreal Engine
learning_objectives: Identify appropriate GPU configurations for different production roles within Unreal Engine.
Implement best practices for level management and organization to optimize project performance and collaboration.
Integrate real-time tools effectively into existing legacy production pipelines.
Utilize Sequencer for shot planning, organization, and non-linear editing.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of traditional film production workflows.
Familiarity with 3D modeling and animation concepts.
General understanding of game engine concepts.
ai_analysis.difficulty_notes: While tagged as 'Beginner', some concepts require familiarity with production pipelines and terminology. The material would be best suited for users with experience in legacy production wanting to transition to Unreal Engine.

courses.title: Lighting_Cinematic_Fundamentals
courses.path: G:\Shared drives\ELT Division\Professional Group Training\CURRENT COURSE CONTENT\VIDEOS\03-Lighting\203.02-Lighting_Cinematic_Fundamentals

learning_objectives: Differentiate between various reflection methods in Unreal Engine 5 and when to use them.
Light a character dynamically using Lumen and Rec Lights.
Configure reflection captures for light baking and understand their limitations.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of Unreal Engine 5 interface and navigation.
Familiarity with lighting concepts (e.g., directional lights, point lights).
Knowledge of light baking workflows.
ai_analysis.difficulty_notes: While categorized as Intermediate, some sections involving Lumen settings and ray tracing may require more advanced knowledge or experimentation.

courses.title: Path Tracer
courses.path: G:\Shared drives\ELT Division\Professional Group Training\CURRENT COURSE CONTENT\VIDEOS\03-Lighting\203.04-Path Tracer

learning_objectives: Troubleshoot ray tracing issues using console variables and level blueprints.
Optimize ray tracing performance by adjusting material roughness, reducing bounces, and utilizing alternative GI methods.
Set up and configure Path Tracer for high-quality rendering.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of Unreal Engine 5 interface.
Familiarity with Blueprint scripting (optional but helpful).
Intermediate knowledge of materials and lighting in Unreal Engine.
ai_analysis.difficulty_notes: The content requires an understanding of intermediate lighting and material concepts. While the instructor demonstrates practical steps, grasping the 'why' behind optimizations requires prior experience.

courses.title: Materials_Introduction
courses.path: G:\Shared drives\ELT Division\Professional Group Training\CURRENT COURSE CONTENT\VIDEOS\01-Material\101.01-Materials_Introduction

subtopics: Material Properties (Domain, Blend Mode, Shading Model)
learning_objectives: Create animated material effects simulating liquid flow.
Understand the basic features and functions of the Unreal Engine 5 Material Editor.
Create and utilize material instances from parent materials.
prerequisites: Basic familiarity with the Unreal Engine 5 interface.
Understanding of basic material concepts (albedo, normal, roughness).
Familiarity with the Content Browser.
ai_analysis.difficulty_notes: While the course is tagged 'Beginner', the material creation process becomes moderately complex with layering effects and using various nodes. A true beginner might need to pause and review certain sections.

Configure a virtual Live Link subject to manually control lens parameters.

learning_objectives: Set up a basic mobile app project with touch input.
Design and implement a UMG-based UI for media playback control (play/pause, looping).
Integrate a media player asset and control it using Blueprint scripting.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of Unreal Engine Editor
Familiarity with Blueprint Visual Scripting fundamentals
Some experience with UMG UI design (beginner level)
Basic understanding of Unreal Engine project setup
ai_analysis.difficulty_notes: While categorized as 'Intermediate', the initial sections are beginner-friendly, gradually increasing in complexity with Blueprint scripting and UI customization. Someone with basic UE5 knowledge can follow along, but a prior knowledge of blueprint is assumed.
